thread.title: Switzerland probes banks over precious metals price fixing
thread.title_full: Switzerland probes banks over precious metals price fixing

title: Switzerland probes banks over precious metals price fixing
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Mon, Sep 28, 2015, 08:58 BST - UK Markets close in 7 hrs 32 mins Switzerland probes banks over precious metals price fixing By Agency | Telegraph â€“ 1 minute 28 seconds ago 0.00 0.00 
The Swiss Competition Commission has launched an investigation into HSBC, Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) and five others 
Swiss competition authorities are investigating HSBC, Barclays, Deutsche Bank (Other OTC: DBAGF - news ) and four other banks on suspicion of price fixing in the precious metals market. 
The Swiss Competition Commission (COMCO) "has today opened an investigation against two Swiss banks, UBS (NYSEArca: FBGX - news ) and Julius Baer (LSE: 0QO6.L - news ) , as well as against the foreign financial institutions Deutsche Bank, HSBC, Barclays, Morgan Stanley (Xetra: 885836 - news ) and Mitsui," it said in a statement. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) said it had indications that the banks had "possibly concluded illegal competition defying deals" in the trade of precious metals like gold, silver and platinum. 
COMCO in particular suspects "possible price fixing deals, especially in connection with 'Spreads'", which is the difference between the bid and asking price, it said. 
The statement gave no further details. 
Some of the banks under investigation were already hit by massive fines earlier this year after pleading guilty to US charges of conspiring to rig Libor interest rates (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) .
